name: ICU
description: The Intensive Care Unit (ICU) is a separate, self-contained area within a medical facility, equipped with high-tech specialised facilities designed for close monitoring, rapid intervention and often extended treatment of patients with acute organ dysfunction.

name: ENT
description: ENTs deal with anything that has to do with the head, neck, and ears in adults and children.

name: vaccinations
description: Vaccination is the administration of a vaccine to help the immune system develop immunity from a disease.

name: Medical Dressage
description: The objective of dressing wounds is to promote healing. The procedure includes cleaning, disinfection and protection of the wound while respecting the rules of hygiene.

name: Laboratory
description: healthcare facilities providing a wide range of laboratory procedures which aid the physicians in carrying out the diagnosis, treatment, and management of patients.
